creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text:
When I use 
<%@ page contentType='text/html; charset=Windows-1251' %>
in root jsp page and use @include I see instead of russian characters - ????? in included files. When I remove contentType='text/html; charset=Windows-1251' all include OK. 
Can you make default encoding property in web.xml (or somewhere) to change default encoding from ISO to my prefered one.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text: Can't reproduce - please include 2 jsp files with russian characters.

This is fixed in 3.2.2.  Costin was looking into this at one point for Tomcat 
3.3.  I'm going to mark is as LATER for now.  When it gets fixed in Tomcat 3.3 
the bug can be closed.
